  Source   Edit

Introspection tools for unions created by the union macro.

Imports

typeutils

Types

Union[T] {.pure.} = object of RootObj

Base type of which all unions inherit from.

It has no properties other than being a typeclass for matching unions.

  Source   Edit 
UnionTy = distinct NimNode

A distinct NimNode representing the type of an Union object.

Internally all Unions are a case object, dispatched via a compile-time generated enum.

  Source   Edit

func add(u: UnionTy; enm, typ: NimNode) {....raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}

Add a variant for typ associated with enum enm to union definition u.

typ and enm should be typed nodes.

Raise KeyError if the typ or enm is already present in the union.

  Source   Edit

Returns whether the type of n is in u.   Source   Edit 
func getUnionType(n: NimNode): UnionTy {....raises: [], tags: [].}

Get the Union type of node n.

Returns nil if n is not an union.

  Source   Edit

    ...raises: [], tags: [].}

func isUnionTy(n: NimNode): bool {....raises: [], tags: [].}

Returns whether n type is an Union.

Outside of macros, x is Union can be used to match for Union type.

  Source   Edit

func typeField(u: UnionTy): NimNode {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns the runtime type field of the union type.   Source   Edit

Iterators

iterator variants(u: UnionTy): tuple[enm, field, typ: NimNode] {....raises: [],
    tags: [].}

Yield the different branches of the union u.

enm is the enum associated with the field, can be checked against typeField/currentType at runtime.

typ is the type of field.

  Source   Edit

Returns whether the type T is in the union type U.   Source   Edit
